TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1023
TEI.2.document_title: Thomas M. Duke to Stephen F. Austin, 01-23-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Thomas M. Duke to Austin, January 23, 1825. Request for certain land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1023

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas M. Duke to Austin, January 23, 1825. Request for certain land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="01-23-1825">Jany. 23 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Coln- Stephen F Austin*/p*
*p*Sir having been informed by *person_mentioned*Mr K. Alley*/person_mentioned* that you have allowed me a labor at this *location_mentioned*River*/location_mentioned* I wish you to enter for me the*location_mentioned* Seventh*/location_mentioned* as *person_mentioned*Captain Grey*/person_mentioned* has declined taking any land in this *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned* and has resigned that labor in my favor I have the survey as receipt for the surveying of the *location_mentioned*thirtieth league*/location_mentioned* and will get *person_mentioned*Mr. Alley*/person_mentioned*'s receipt for the labor and would wish to have my deed as soon as it would be convenient as I shall not be in town more than once before I go to *location_mentioned*Kentucky*/location_mentioned* which will be as soon as the Grass rises in the *date_mentioned n="Spring-1825">Spring*/date_mentioned*
*/p**p**person_mentioned*Thos- M. Duke*/person_mentioned* */p* [Rubric]
*/div1*
